item.title: Academic
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.getJSON('https://api.github.com/repos/gcushen/hugo-academic/tags').done(function (json) { let release = json[0]; // let downloadURL = release.zipball_url; $('#academic-release').text('Latest release ' + release.name); }); }
Currently Post-doc at iDiv in Leipzig working with Marten Winter. Interested in Macro-ecology, Functional diversity, Open Science and Reproducible Science.

item.title: R Packages
item.description: package name package status description ecolottery an R package to simulate community assembly using coalescent theory funrar Compute functional rarity indices (see more at https://rekyt.github.io/funrar/) rromeo   R client to SHERPA/RoMEO the database on journal archival policies (see more at https://ropensci.github.io/rromeo/) rtaxref R client to the French Taxonomic Reference (see more at https://rekyt.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am a certified Instructor for The Carpentries, focusing on R programming (especially for ecology) and Data Visualization. I also taught the following courses at the University of Montpellier: HLMA314 Practicals in Descriptive Statistics for Ecology 2017-2018, HLBE405 Practical project in Functional Ecology, HLMA314 Practicals in Descriptive Statistics for Ecology 2018-2019. I also found the R User Group of our lab and organize regular meetups for the group.
